snippet: The bill, approved by the Senate, faces severe resistance as written because of what some conservatives see as too many allotments for projects far from the Hurricane Sandy disaster zone.
abstract: House will move ahead with multibillion-dollar package to provide aid to victims of Hurricane Sandy, but legislation is caught in escalating debate over spending and deficits that foreshadows another ugly fight among Republicans; bill has been approved by the Senate but faces severe resistance by conservatives.

byline.original: By RAYMOND HERNANDEZ and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: The bill, approved by the Senate, faces severe resistance as written because of what some conservatives see as too many allotments for projects far from the Hurricane Sandy disaster zone.

headline.seo: House to Take Up Storm Relief Bill Amid Entrenched Battle Over Spending
headline.main: House to Take Up Storm Relief Bill Amid Battle Over Spending
headline.print_headline: House to Take Up Storm Relief Bill Amid Battle Over Spending
